page.title: 03An Interview With the Vicar
page.content:
We interviewed the{Reverend Thomas} and we asked him some questions about old people's homes in Plympton. { St Elizbeths}home is for old people who can move about and are not bed ridden. There are 25 residents and 25 rooms in St Elizabeths. At St Elizbeths they have their own vegetable garden. When people get too ill they go to {St Vincents}nursing home. At St Vincents sisters, matrons and nurses look after the sick people. The old people at St Vincents are bedridden and they're not allowed out of thier room. St Vincents has 24 patients and 24 rooms.
{This work is by
{ADAM TEDESCO and GLYN JOHNSON
